item.title: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu formally asks to be pardoned from corruption charges
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally asked for a pardon from President Isaac Herzog relating to corruption charges against him.

item.title: Weight loss drugs are rewriting the global business of how we eat
item.description: The explosive rise of drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro is shifting consumption patterns, health outcomes and pushing pharmaceutical giants into trillion-dollar valuations.

item.title: Albanese reached his zenith in 2025, but 2026 could test the limits of Labor's power
item.description: It is hard to imagine a better end to the prime minister's year than this one, but realists in government know Labor can't continue to ride the wave.

item.title: This week in history quiz: Can you ace our test on events from the past?
item.description: From reality TV and heist movie remakes to man's last step on the Moon — how well do you know this week in history?

item.title: Early childhood education minister refuses to say if independent inquiry into childcare standards will happen
item.description: The early childhood education minister is refusing to say whether the federal government will establish an independent review of childcare standards.

item.title: Tech companies advised to label and 'watermark' AI-generated content
item.description: With AI deepfakes causing confusion and harm online, the federal government tells tech developers that AI content should be clearly labelled, ahead of a National AI Plan due to be released.

item.title: England's Ashes demolition job of Australia in Brisbane's first ever cricket Test match at the Ekka
item.description: Australia's Ashes domination in Brisbane is almost total, with England winless at the Gabba since 1986. It wasn't always like this though, with the first visit to Brisbane resulting in the heaviest defeat in cricket history.

item.title: Incoming Australian social media ban leaves children vulnerable to phishing scams, experts say
item.description: As the social media ban comes into effect, experts are worried children and families will be left vulnerable to age verification scams. Here's why.

item.title: Italian-Australian glass artist takes her work from Carnarvon to Venice
item.description: Sabrina's father warned her she couldn't make a living from art, but after decades in a sensible job she's now making waves in the world of glass art.

item.title: Dicky Bill salad farms enter administration with 180 job cuts before Christmas
item.description: Australian salad grower Dicky Bill enters administration, putting 180 people out of work before Christmas.

item.title: Hinchinbrook by-election a tick of approval for LNP government but no crystal ball for outcome of next election
item.description: A week is a long time in politics, let alone three years, and the LNP's success at the next election is by no means assured, writes Jack McKay.

item.title: Lebanese hopeful Pope Leo will bring peace as he visits the country
item.description: As Pope Leo visits Lebanon, many locals hope he will bring peace to the region, viewing the visit as a message of solidarity.

item.title: Australia's Travis Head prepared to play any role in day-night Ashes Test against England
item.description: Travis Head says he has no qualms if he is shifted back down Australia's batting order following his exploits as an opener in the first Ashes Test.

item.title: The Macquarie Point stadium decision is due this week — here's how it could play out
item.description: The long-running debate over whether an AFL stadium should be built on Hobart's waterfront is reaching an end, as the parliamentary vote takes place this week.

item.title: Parents in NSW warned of potentially more school closures due to bushfire risk
item.description: Public school parents in New South Wales have been advised school closures may occur on days of elevated fire danger.

item.title: ASX outage stops trade in dozens of shares, market slides on Metcash, AUB and CSL
item.description: Professional investors slam another "embarrassing" ASX technical glitch, which saw trading halted in around 50 stocks as companies were unable to publish price-sensitive announcements.

item.title: Domestic violence abusers have 'weaponised' smart cars to terrorise their victims
item.description: A new eSafety advisory warns Australians about technology-facilitated abuse and provides advice on how to protect themselves from it.

item.title: Federal politics: Australia monitoring Chinese task group in Philippine Sea, Marles says — as it happened
item.description: Australia is monitoring a Chinese task group in the Philippine Sea, Defence Minister Richard Marles says.

item.title: Australia humbled by New Zealand in Dubai rugby sevens finals
item.description: Australia falls to its trans-Tasman rivals in both the women's and men's finals at the season-opening leg of the world series.

item.title: Big haul of 170yo Indigenous artefacts unearthed in North West Queensland
item.description: A stash of Aboriginal artefacts, dating back about 170 years, is unearthed from the red dirt of outback Queensland, bringing history to life for the local Pitta Pitta people.

item.title: Thousands of Australians losing free-to-air tv access and facing internet outages
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Opticomm customers across Australia losing free-to-air television and facing internet outages
item.description: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television using their existing technology. And the troubles do not end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

item.title: Eight ways to drink less during Christmas party season
item.description: If you want to drink less (or not at all) this silly season, you don't have to rely on willpower alone. Having a plan can help.

item.title: Rubio says Ukraine talks in US productive but work remains to find peace deal
item.description: Marco Rubio says he expects the talks between US and Ukrainian officials on Sunday about finding a peace deal with Russia to yield progress in ending the war.

item.title: Energy grid not ready for Eraring coal plant's closure, AEMO says
item.description: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

item.title: Christmas Island's last dog embraced by the remote community
item.description: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate Labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

item.title: Meningococcal B scare prompts call for free immunisation program
item.description: Charlie was in a coma for days after contracting the rare but preventable disease. He was lucky to survive.

item.title: Sensitive parliament communications handed to contractor without security clearance
item.description: The team of a contractor that was the victim of a Russia-linked hack did not have the necessary security clearance when it received thousands of sensitive communications between politicians and parliamentary staff, in a mistake the department has now conceded.

item.title: Richard Harris on hand for recovery of body from Tank Cave near Mount Gambier
item.description: Thai cave rescue hero Dr Richard Harris is among a team of cave diving specialists on hand to retrieve the body of a Victorian man trapped in one of Australia's longest underwater caves.

item.title: Four men charged by NSW Police over alleged 'satanic' child abuse material ring
item.description: Four Sydney men are charged as police allege the group distributed "ritualistic and satanic" child abuse material online.

item.title: Emerson Jones and James Duckworth receive wildcards ahead of 2026 Australian Open
item.description: Teen star Emerson Jones becomes one of the youngest Australians to receive a wildcard to the Australian Open after stellar performances at tournaments in November.

item.title: Geraldton bushfire destroys one home as up to 200 firefighters worked to control blaze
item.description: Authorities have downgraded their warning levels for bushfires burning in the greater Geraldton area to an 'advice' level after a challenging day for firefighters.

item.title: Police hope spelling errors could identify Glenunga high school threat suspect
item.description: An image of spiders' legs in the shape of the logo of an Adelaide high school is among several bizarre clues that have been released in the hope they could help police identify the person who is behind a series of threatening emails.

item.title: Ngangkaṟi share traditional healing in new edition of book that went global
item.description: The Ngangkaṟi in Central Australia use traditional healing techniques to draw out illness with their hands. A new edition of their book aims to share this knowledge Western health workers.

item.title: Government unveils Department of Defence overhaul amid delays and cost blowouts
item.description: Three groups within Defence will be rolled into one entity as part of a sweeping restructure of the department.

item.title: Man pleads guilty to manslaughter of surfer Guy Haymes in Manly
item.description: A man has admitted to fatally bashing a well-known surfer on Sydney's northern beaches during a dispute in which he accused him of stealing $50.

item.title: Trump wants Venezuela's airspace closed — but international law stands in the way
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Venezuela's airspace should be considered closed. According to international law, it's not that simple.

item.title: Popular and easy summer desserts
item.description: Summer desserts are for sharing and we have 10 options for end-of-year gatherings and Christmas.

item.title: $3.4 billion Coomera Connector stage one to open after construction cracks probed
item.description: Motorists will be able to use the first 4-kilometre stretch of the new Coomera Connector as an alternative to the busy Pacific Motorway from Tuesday.

item.title: Tourist and Hobart Penitentiary volunteer's chance discovery of shared convict history
item.description: A Victorian tourist has been "blown away" after discovering a connection with a volunteer at the Hobart Penitentiary, with the volunteer noting people seem more open to discussing their convict histories.

item.title: Luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV collapses into administration
item.description: Hundreds of Zone RV employees are out of work weeks before Christmas after arriving at work on Monday morning and being told the bad news.

item.title: Diver's body recovered after incident in Tank Cave in SA's south-east
item.description: The body of a man who died while cave diving in South Australia's south-east on Sunday has now been recovered, police say.

item.title: Case against teens charged over Adelaide shopping centre stabbing could move to adult court
item.description: Prosecutors are "likely" to consider asking for the case against two teenagers charged over a stabbing — which sent an Adelaide shopping centre into lockdown — to be moved to an adult court.

item.title: Watchdog updates warnings for Ozempic-style drugs over potential risk of suicidal thoughts
item.description: Australia's medicines regulator issues a safety warning over the potential risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviours when taking Ozempic-style drugs.

item.title: NSW government, energy company under fire after native bird habitat cleared for renewables project
item.description: The NSW government's flagship renewable energy project has come under fire after trees containing dozens of hatchlings were cut down.

item.title: First day of summer delivers record heat in the west, record cold in the east
item.description: Summer has arrived in Australia with a bang, with fire and searing heat in the west, while a sprinkling of snow accompanied record cold temperatures in the south-east of the country.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Businesses using 'branded identifiers' in SMS messages now need to register them
item.description: Organisations using branded identifiers in their text messages to consumers will need to register them by July 1, 2026, or risk being mistaken for a scam.

item.title: Prosecutors call last witnesses in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley
item.description: The jury in the former Innisfail nurse's murder trial has heard more than three weeks of evidence.

item.title: Sam Kerr edges closer to injury return in final Matildas friendly vs New Zealand before Asian Cup
item.description: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

item.title: Inquest hears man likely experiencing psychosis was carrying fake gun and planning 'suicide by cop'
item.description: An inquest into a 2024 police shooting in Nowra on the NSW South Coast hears police gunned down a man who was carrying a fake gun with the intention of being killed.

item.title: Inquest into fatal Sea World helicopter crash hears chief pilot went 'above and beyond' and prioritised safety
item.description: The executive assistant of chief pilot Ashley Jenkinson has appeared before a coronial inquest into the 2023 tragedy.

item.title: Think tank says an overlooked solution to Australia's housing crisis could unlock about 1 million new homes
item.description: The public policy think tank, CEDA, believes Australia could increase its current housing stock by nine per cent if just one in four standalone homes in the five biggest cities are developed into dual occupancies.

item.title: UK MP Tulip Siddiq sentenced to prison in Bangladesh in corruption case linked to her aunt, former PM Sheikh Hasina
item.description: Tulip Siddiq says the decision should be treated with "contempt", while her political party says she was not afforded due process.

item.title: World Health Organization recommends Ozempic-style medications as long-term obesity treatments
item.description: Ozempic-style medications have been recommended as long-term treatments for obesity under new guidelines released by the World Health Organization.

item.title: Flooding in Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka kills more than 1,160 people as recovery efforts continue
item.description: Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka are reeling from flooding that has killed hundreds in each country and destroyed communities.

item.title: One fire, two systems: Hong Kong's grief meets Beijing's red lines
item.description: The blaze that consumed Wang Fuk Court burned for two days, but its political shock waves may echo for weeks, even months.

item.title: Pablo Escobar's final mistake and the lonely death of the cocaine king
item.description: More than three decades since his death in a rooftop shootout with police, the legacy of cocaine king Pablo Escobar continues to affect Colombia.

item.title: Tasmanians express mix of views ahead of final Macquarie Point stadium vote
item.description: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

item.title: Woolworths accused of exploiting affordable housing schemes to push new developments
item.description: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.

item.title: Is social media masking bushwalking dangers and leading to poor hiking decisions?
item.description: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

item.title: Tumbling Bitcoin's last useful business — money laundering — under threat from Tether
item.description: It remains a useful tool for some nefarious operators, including global crime gangs and questionable governments, but Bitcoin's role has been usurped by stablecoins — one in particular.

item.title: NDIS cuts Deaf man's Auslan funding, recommends he explore 'other communication methods'
item.description: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

item.title: Victoria seeks to change 'unconstitutional' donation laws amid High Court challenge
item.description: A financial election advantage for the three biggest Victorian political parties will be removed in the face of a High Court challenge that has argued the state's donation laws are unconstitutional.

item.title: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success
item.description: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

item.title: Artificial intelligence to be managed through existing laws under National AI Plan
item.description: The federal government's long-awaited National AI Plan will seek to accelerate the growth of artificial intelligence in Australia, and largely leverage existing laws to protect against its worst harms.

item.title: Why you should read the fine print when purchasing a gift card this festive season
item.description: If you receive a gift card for Christmas this year you might fall foul of "activation rules". Here's how.

item.title: Two men first in SA to be found guilty of charges arising from encrypted devices
item.description: Two South Australian men are the first in the state to be found guilty after standing trial for charges arising from the major police operation.

item.title: Two teenage boys charged over fire at Deniliquin High School
item.description: Two teenage boys have been charged over a weekend fire that extensively damaged Deniliquin High School in the NSW Riverina.

item.title: Secret government audit reveals how big travel companies can overcharge clients
item.description: The document, prepared for the Queensland government, has been exclusively obtained by the ABC.

item.title: As teacher shortages loom across Australia these Queensland schools are trialling solutions
item.description: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

item.title: Federal politics: Defence sexual violence convictions to be recorded on national database — as it happened
item.description: The veterans' affairs minister says Defence personnel who commit sexual violence will have their convictions recorded on their national criminal history check.

item.title: Andrew Lethlean undecided on whether to challenge Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East
item.description: Nationals favourite Andrew Lethlean is tight-lipped on whether he will challenge Premier Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East next year.

item.title: Filmmaker breaks decades of silence over Yolŋu clan leader's alleged murder by police
item.description: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

item.title: Pat Conroy on the landmark inquiry into sexual violence in the ADF
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Geraldton resident Nick Morgan grateful for support after losing home in bushfires
item.description: A home owner who lost his house and his cat to a bushfire in Geraldton, in WA's Mid West, says "karma" is looking for anyone who may have deliberately lit the blazes.

item.title: Son of drug kingpin 'El Chapo' pleads guilty in US drug trafficking case in deal with prosecutors
item.description: A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo" pleads guilty to US drug trafficking charges, months after his brother entered a plea deal.

item.title: White House says Hegseth authorised admiral to strike alleged drug boat
item.description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth authorised an admiral to conduct multiple strikes that killed 11 people on a vessel from Venezuela allegedly carrying illegal narcotics in September.

item.title: South Australian farmers fear future as bird flu recovery causes egg oversupply
item.description: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

item.title: ASX edges higher, Bitcoin dives, government releases its National AI Plan - as it happened
item.description: The ASX edged higher, while the federal government released its National AI Plan. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Scathing 'jobs for mates' review finds government appointments too often look like 'nepotism'
item.description: A report into government appointments to boards savages the system, which it says too often allows governments to award friends or pick candidates for political purposes, eroding trust with the public.

item.title: Allegations of sexual misconduct levelled at father-son Bowen therapists in Ballarat
item.description: Five women allege sexual misconduct against a Ballarat Bowen therapy business run by a father-son duo.

item.title: Princess Aiko's popularity sparks calls to ditch male-only succession law in Japan
item.description: Historically, Japan has had numerous women monarchs. But current laws prevent the emperor's daughter from succeeding him — and politicians, including the prime minister, support the status quo.

item.title: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro calls out Australian football's 'inferiority complex' in passionate plea
item.description: Joe Montemurro echoes the words of former Matildas boss Alen Stajcic in offering a frank review of the culture surrounding the world game in Australia.

item.title: How Wiradjuri constellations like the Great Celestial Emu make us look at the sky in a different way
item.description: All 88 internationally recognised constellations have European origins. But First Nations astronomy tells older, beautiful stories that contain invaluable lessons and knowledge.

item.title: Supreme Court proceeding starts in Broome over alleged murder
item.description: Ian Ralph Brooke has been found unfit to stand trial for murder, with a special proceedings hearing underway.

item.title: Statistically, it's impossible to predict domestic violence homicide. That doesn't mean we should give up
item.description: Victims must always be believed. The uncomfortable truth, however, is that statistically, it is almost impossible to predict lethal family violence because it is so rare.

item.title: Submarine tour, roof protest and shark encounter feature in our top WA photos for November
item.description: Our photographers cast their eyes towards WA's exploding rabbit population, a surfer's near-miss with a suspected great white shark, and a school program helping parents bond with their children.

item.title: Former prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor stripped of remaining titles
item.description: Andrew has been under renewed pressure in recent weeks over his relationship with late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and has been summoned to appear before a US congressional panel investigating Epstein.

item.title: Man jailed for 17 years over home invasion murder of Ashley Gordon
item.description: Ashley Gordon grew up in the Victorian coal mining town of Morwell and went on to become a doctor before he was murdered.

item.title: Western Bulldogs former number one AFLW pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner wants to join North Melbourne
item.description: The Kangaroos' domination of the AFLW is set to be given another boost, with a former number one draft pick confirming she wants to head to North.

item.title: Red Bull admits fault over 'clearly incorrect' suggestion Kimi Antonelli allowed Lando Norris to overtake him
item.description: Red Bull retracts suggestions made by its engineer that Mercedes driver Kimi Antonelli deliberately let Lando Norris overtake him at the Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: South Coast fishermen charged over alleged deliberate scuttling of trawler
item.description: Two Ulladulla fishermen have been charged under federal sea-dumping laws over the alleged deliberate sinking of an unseaworthy trawler.

item.title: Farmer killed fighting West River bushfire near Ravensthorpe on WA's south coast
item.description: A man is killed while trying to establish a firebreak to help tackle a blaze near Ravensthorpe along WA's south coast, with the premier describing his death as "devastating".

item.title: Man charged with murder after Far North Queensland stabbing
item.description: A 63-year-old man charged with murder (domestic violence) is due to face Cairns Magistrates Court on Wednesday.

item.title: Right to repair reforms to be expanded to farm machinery
item.description: After years of depending on dealership networks for essential repairs, farmers will have the right to fix their own equipment.

item.title: Experts unsure why sea snake deaths are increasing at Shark Bay World Heritage site
item.description: Locals and marine life experts raise concern over an increased amount of reptiles washing up on WA's north-west shores, with reports of stranded sea snakes and turtles being spotted on beaches.

item.title: Perth Bears sign halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for 2027 NRL season
item.description: The NRL's Perth expansion team secures the signature of former Bulldogs halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for their inaugural season in 2027.

item.title: E-bike rider killed in collision with garbage truck in Sydney CBD as NSW premier announces new legislation
item.description: The rider, a man aged in his 30s, was treated by paramedics but could not be saved.

item.title: Folk Rhythm and Life Festival cancelled at last minute due to permit problems
item.description: A festival that has been running for 30 years has been cancelled just days before it was due to begin.

item.title: Papua New Guinea calls for 'buffer zone' with Indonesia amid concerns over West Papua conflict
item.description: Australia, Papua New Guinea and Indonesia have started holding annual defence ministers meetings to build trust and boost military cooperation, while PNG proposes building a 10km-wide demilitarised "buffer zone" along its border with Indonesia.

item.title: Victoria's first summer Japanese encephalitis virus detection at Horsham in state's west
item.description: The first detection of Japanese encephalitis virus for the summer has been made in a rural Victorian city.

item.title: New details of ADF sexual violence probe revealed
item.description: Minister Matt Keogh is addressing the National Press Club a year after the government responded to the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.

item.title: Elderly woman allegedly assaulted in 'unprovoked and isolated' incident at South Plympton
item.description: Police say members of the public helped the 84-year-old woman after the alleged attack before she was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

item.title: Man pleads guilty over culpable driving hit and run that killed motorcyclist at Yarck
item.description: David Graham Berry was set to face trial over a hit and run in northern Victoria, but has instead pleaded guilty at a hearing in Shepparton.

item.title: Spear fisher accused of killing protected blue groper on NSW Central Coast
item.description: Investigations are underway into the death of the near-threatened species on the NSW Central Coast, prompting calls for better awareness about local marine life.

item.title: Beekeepers warn of food price increases amid varroa mite battle in South Australia
item.description: Beekeepers say the escalating cost of pollinating crops will be passed onto consumers as the industry battles a devastating bee killer.

item.title: Fugitive prisoner who evaded police for months charged after dramatic Alice Springs arrest
item.description: An absconded prisoner has been charged with 15 offences, including strangulation and making threats to kill, after escaping police custody and evading capture for more than 70 days.

item.title: Former NSW Premier Barry O'Farrell slams 'brain fart' behind latest Wests Tigers turmoil
item.description: Former New South Wales premier and sacked Wests Tigers chair Barry O'Farrell believes the NRL could be forced to intervene at the joint venture following the latest round of boardroom chaos.

item.title: Former Flight Centre employee jailed for stealing $40,000 from Canberra branch
item.description: A 39-year-old man has been jailed for two years after stealing cash from a secure drawer at Flight Centre in Canberra at least seven times, and then mountinga campaign of dishonesty" to delay sentencing.

item.title: Musicians from small organisations lead the charge to platform people with disability
item.description: Going to a concert can be hard for people with disability. But sensory concerts and bringing lived experience on stage can open up this world for everyone.

item.title: My daughter has two mums. I'm her other mother
item.description: Even though I am Evie's favourite — I am, after all, the fun mum — I can't shake the feeling that when it comes to serious mothering, I'm the spare. Her back-up mum.

item.title: Where US and Venezuelan alliances lie as tensions escalate in the Caribbean
item.description: As the United States mounts pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, nations in the Caribbean, South America and across the world are revealing where their support lies.

item.title: Australian National University abandons plan to axe the School of Music after public pressure
item.description: The Australian National University has abandoned a controversial plan to absorb its School of Music into a single course after extraordinary public pressure.

item.title: Pilliga murder trial hinges on mental state of man who killed his father
item.description: The mental state of a man who has admitted to killing his father at Pilliga in north-west New South Wales will be key to the outcome of his murder trial.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley wanted to be 'needle in a haystack' in India, court hears
item.description: Former nurse Rajwinder Singh has pleaded not guilty to the murder of 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley in Far North Queensland in October 2018.

item.title: Parliamentary inquiry calls for pause on plan to demolish Melbourne's public housing towers
item.description: A parliamentary inquiry has called on the government to halt the demolition of Melbourne's public housing towers after finding it refused to provide evidence to justify the plan.

item.title: Concerns still remain as Northern Water names site for $5bn desal plant
item.description: The long-awaited decision for a Northern Water project has arrived — but it has come with environmental contention.

item.title: Neighbour called abuse line to report mother accused of daughter's neglect, court hears
item.description: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.

item.title: Jeremy Rockliff speaks ahead of stadium vote
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Canberra man jailed over violent road rage incidents, fined for performing Nazi salute outside synagogue
item.description: A Canberra man has been jailed over a string of road rage attacks committed "for trivial reasons", and fined $10,000 for performing a Nazi salute outside a Queensland synagogue.

item.title: Echuca man Jake Cartledge jailed over 'horrific' crash that killed girlfriend and younger brother
item.description: A young driver who attempted a "power skid" before slamming into a tree has been sentenced over the deaths of his girlfriend and younger brother.

item.title: Bunbury man jailed three-and-a-half years for filming people using public toilets in WA
item.description: A 42-year-old Bunbury man has been sentenced to three years and six months jail for filming people, including children, using public bathrooms across Western Australia.

item.title: 'Gun fanatic' ex-police officer to stand trial in Victoria over weapons cache
item.description: A former police officer is set to face trial after investigators allegedly uncovered a large cache of weapons, firearm parts and chemicals on his property.

item.title: New images show Chinese flotilla with formidable firepower in Philippine Sea
item.description: Private firm Starboard Maritime Intelligence says it has used satellite technology to track down the People's Liberation Army Navy task group.

item.title: Rise in threats by sovereign citizens sparks call for Victorian judges to receive security allowance
item.description: A report tabled in state parliament has recommended judicial officers be paid an allowance to increase their personal security.

item.title: Fears of spying and interrogation as 'mega' Chinese embassy in London looks set for approval
item.description: Underneath central London cables carrying vital financial information run and soon China's new embassy, which has redacted floor plans, could sit atop them.

item.title: Optus reveals nearly half a million phones may be unable to dial Triple Zero
item.description: The figure has been provided to a Senate estimates hearing, where the media regulator appeared on Tuesday.

item.title: Parkway Drive's Park Waves festival cancelled ahead of 2026 Australian debut
item.description: Park Waves festival, set for February 2026, has been cancelled amid economic challenges, joining a growing list of scrapped Australian music events.

item.title: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne breached parliamentarians' code of conduct with anonymous text criticising Elizabeth Lee
item.description: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne is found to have breached the code of conduct for a parliamentarian over an anonymous text message she sent criticising former Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee.

item.title: Queensland man Brett Daniel Taylor charged with assisted suicides of three people granted bail
item.description: A Queensland man charged with assisting the suicides of three people has successfully applied for bail.

item.title: Hong Kong leader orders independent probe into deadly blaze
item.description: Hong Kong will set up an independent committee to investigate the cause of the city's deadliest fire in decades, including the oversight of the renovations blamed for the disaster.

item.title: England trio Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith spotted riding e-scooters without helmets in Brisbane
item.description: England captain Ben Stokes and several teammates have been spotted in Brisbane riding e-scooters without helmets ahead of the second Ashes Test.

item.title: Usman Khawaja ruled out of Brisbane Test following back injury, Travis Head set to open
item.description: Australia will be without veteran opener Usman Khawaja for the second Ashes Test after the 38-year old was ruled out due to an ongoing back problem.

item.title: Ravensthorpe deputy shire president Mark Mudie killed in West River fire
item.description: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south is identified as the local town's deputy shire president.

item.title: Ex-AFL agent Ricky Nixon found guilty of selling fake football memorabilia
item.description: After facing AFL premiership players in court, a former player agent is fined $4,500 for selling fraudulent memorabilia from the 2021 grand final.

item.title: Review into incident at Tasmania's Ashley Youth Detention Centre of makeshift spit hood on detainee's head tabled in parliament
item.description: An incident at a Tasmanian youth detention centre where a detainee had an improvised spit hood put over his head while being transported by a contracted security company, has been criticised for being "entirely incompatible" with human rights.

item.title: Three deaths related to asbestos exposure at former ABC site
item.description: Staff at the former ABC studios in Elsternwick were exposed to asbestos over an extended period.

item.title: Singapore-based firm scraps Darwin hotel project after sacred site fight
item.description: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.

item.title: Employees ponder bleak Christmas after sudden collapse of caravan manufacturer Zone RV
item.description: Questions are being asked about why Zone RV fell into administration, leaving hundreds of workers unemployed and customers in limbo.

item.title: Six prisoners remain in NT watch houses after report exposes 'inhumane' conditions
item.description: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

item.title: Victoria Police granted expanded stop-and-search powers
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ACT legislates commitment for public servants to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle' in Australian first
item.description: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

item.title: Tasmanian politicians feel the pressure ahead of Macquarie Point Stadium vote
item.description: State politicians face a looming debate in parliament's upper house, which will finally decide whether a stadium is built at Hobart's Macquarie Point and whether Tasmania gets an AFL side.

item.title: Government reveals national AI plan to 'serve' Australians
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann to learn fate of his Federal Court appeal of failed defamation case
item.description: A decision in Bruce Lehrmann's Federal Court appeal to the findings in his failed defamation case against Network Ten will be handed down tomorrow — and whatever the outcome, there will be consequences for all.

item.title: WA Electoral Commissioner Robert Kennedy resigns months after problem-plagued state election
item.description: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

item.title: Lemon8 and Yope put on notice as social media age ban targets
item.description: Social media platforms Lemon8 and Yope are put on notice about age limit laws as both apps surge in popularity ahead of a ban for under 16s.

item.title: Court lifts suppression order on Greg Lynn's past interactions with police, death of first wife
item.description: Victoria's Supreme Court lifts a suppression order that prohibited reporting on convicted murderer Greg Lynn's past interactions with police and the death of his first wife.

item.title: Family of Greg Lynn's late first wife, Lisa Lynn, reveals High Country killer's abusive past
item.description: Decades before Greg Lynn was convicted of murdering an elderly camper in Victoria's High Country, he subjected his first wife to abuse and death threats as their marriage deteriorated, an ABC investigation has revealed.

item.title: End to war in Ukraine 'no closer' after US-Russia talks
item.description: The Kremlin says a resolution to the war in Ukraine is "no closer" after a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and two of Donald Trump's most powerful envoys.

item.title: Japan and China coast guards offer conflicting accounts of incident near disputed islands
item.description: Tokyo and Beijing have given different accounts of the clash as relations between the two countries continue to sour following comments made by Japan's prime minister about Taiwan.

item.title: Prada Group purchases fashion rival Versace in $2.2bn deal
item.description: The move is expected to revive Versace's fortunes, after middling post-pandemic performance as part of the US luxury group Capri Holdings.

item.title: Imran Khan is alive but suffering psychological strain and isolation in prison, his sister says
item.description: The imprisoned former Pakistani prime minister is visited by one of his sisters for the first time in weeks, providing an update on his health after rumours swirled about his wellbeing.

item.title: Indian government demands Sanchar Saathi app be pre-installed on Apple, Android and Xiaomi mobile phones
item.description: New Delhi wants a government app installed on all of the country's mobile phones, but opposition MPs and privacy advocates have voiced concerns about surveillance.

item.title: MPs to probe Crown Estate property portfolio after Mountbatten-Windsor lease revelations
item.description: MPs in the United Kingdom will investigate the Crown Estate, after revelations Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor — Queen Elizabeth II's second son — had not paid rent for two decades sparked outrage.

item.title: Today in history, December 3: Bhopal gas leak kills thousands in world's worst industrial accident
item.description: It started with a cloud of gas in the dead of night, silently submerging the city in a toxic soup. By morning on December 3, 1984, an Indian city awoke to a nightmare.

item.title: Distance quiz: How well do you know your Australian islands?
item.description: Do you know how far away Heard Island is? What about Christmas Island? Try your hand at today's quiz.

item.title: The secret sauce powering the schools punching above their weight in NAPLAN
item.description: Parents can check the latest NAPLAN scores for 10,000 schools across the country on the MySchool website.

item.title: Small businesses losing thousands to fraudulent online chargeback claims
item.description: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

item.title: Australia's day-night Ashes Test against England comes months after a demolition of West Indies
item.description: The last time Australia played a Test with the pink ball, the brilliance of Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland turned the game into a farce.

item.title: Environment Protection Authority to monitor Ballarat Gold Mine amid air pollution concerns
item.description: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

item.title: Foo Fighters announce Launceston concert for January
item.description: Foo Fighters, one of the biggest bands in the world, will play just one small Australian city when they travel out here in January.

item.title: Telco Southern Phone fined $2.5m for breaching anti-scam laws over 8 months
item.description: The Australian Telecommunications and Media Authority says scammers were able to manipulate the telco's systems to bypass required identity verification processes.

item.title: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32 million lawsuit
item.description: Seven years ago, cancer patients forced to travel overseas for proton therapy were promised an Australian-based service — but the project collapsed last year and is now at the centre of a multi-million-dollar lawsuit.

item.title: Israel wants buffer zone between occupied Golan Heights and Damascus in peace deal with Syria
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu demands Syria establish a "demilitarised zone" between the border with the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights and capital Damascus, as part of any possible peace deal with the new Syrian government.

item.title: Australia's longest-running radio show celebrates 80 years of rural storytelling
item.description: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

item.title: NSW Police response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing to be probed by watchdog
item.description: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

item.title: Man charged in National Guard shooting pleads not guilty from hospital bed
item.description: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, 29, has pleaded not guilty to first-degree murder and assault charges.

item.title: CFMEU inquiry to hear from rival union boss who reported 'orchestrated campaign' of threats to top cops
item.description: The commission of inquiry into alleged misconduct and corruption within the state division of the CFMEU is holding its second block of public hearings in Brisbane.

item.title: Typing error triggers chain of mistakes for Canberra to Sydney Qantas flight
item.description: A data-entry mistake by a Qantas employee set off a series of errors that caused a Boeing 737 to take off slower than it should have.

item.title: Backpackers and PALM scheme workers scrambling for jobs after Dicky Bill shutdown
item.description: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

item.title: Indonesians at a shelter after floods hit Northern Sumatra
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Locals in Langkat recover after floods hit Indonesia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Drone footage shows destruction of a village in Langkat, North Sumatra
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: South-East Asian floods leave more than 1 million people homeless across Indonesia and Sri Lanka
item.description: More than 1,300 people are dead and 1.2 million displaced following devastating flooding and landslides in South-East Asia.

item.title: Indonesian diaspora divided over new Global Citizenship visa scheme as new details emerge
item.description: Indonesia's new visa scheme is being touted as a solution to dual citizenship. But some in the Indonesian community say the visa has "no real benefit" and amounts to a government revenue grab.

item.title: Three Paralympians talk about how disability altered their lives in documentary Changing Track
item.description: Filmmaking siblings Tristan and Timothy Kenyon's documentary Changing Track explores how competing in the Paralympics changes lives.

item.title: England cricketing great Robin Smith dies in Perth aged 62
item.description: The cricket world mourns after the death of English batting great Robin Smith in his Perth home.

item.title: Three in four autistic children want to play more sport but avoidable barriers stand in their way
item.description: Hayley masks their struggles so well in dance class that teachers can't tell. But when they get home, they collapse — sometimes missing days of school.

item.title: Gold Coast council's Springbrook cableway edges forward but with slashed funding
item.description: The Gold Coast's long-running cableway proposal has inched forward after councillors redirected funds from First Nations consultation to environmental studies.

item.title: Federal politics live: YouTube hits out at 'rushed' social media ban, but will comply
item.description: YouTube agrees to comply with Australia's under 16s social media ban but repeats its criticism of the law and says it "won't keep teens safer online". Follow live.

item.title: Pete Hegseth defends second US strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat
item.description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defends authorising a follow-up strike on a Venezuelan boat that killed 11 people.

item.title: Man allegedly found 'hiding underwater' arrested after fatal shooting at Beenleigh, south of Brisbane
item.description: Police allege a stolen vehicle with stolen registration plates left the scene soon after the shooting and was later spotted on the Gold Coast.

item.title: Motorcyclists call for dangerous potholes to be fixed on Limestone Coast
item.description: Motorcyclists in regional SA and south-west Victoria say pothole-riddled regional roads are taking a physical, mental and financial toll on riders.

item.title: Hobart stadium debate live: Key independent Bec Thomas announces support for project ahead of vote
item.description: Independent MLC Bec Thomas tells ABC Mornings her support for the Hobart stadium is "one of the hardest decisions that I've had to make". The project is now extremely likely to have the required number of votes to pass the upper house. Follow live.

item.title: WA Police Arson Squad pinpoint ignition point of Geraldton bushfire that destroyed home
item.description: Police offer up a $25,000 reward as they try to determine the cause of a blaze that tore through 160 hectares of land, left two homes uninhabitable and completely destroyed another in Geraldton.

item.title: Markets live updates: ASX rises ahead of GDP figures, RBA's Bullock says inflation strategy 'absolutely not' a failure
item.description: Michele Bullock appears before Senate estimates. The local share market is likely to rise in morning trade. The ABS will release new figures showing the Australian economy likely grew 2.2 per cent in the year to September, according to economist predictions. Follow live.

item.title: Sam Kerr praised in Matildas return as Australia beats New Zealand 2-0
item.description: Sam Kerr makes her long-awaited return to the Matildas on home soil as Australia downs New Zealand 2-0.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Queensland's attorney-general looking to strengthen drug driving laws after death of Kathleen Dennis
item.description: The family of a beloved Queensland mother of seven, killed by a driver with meth in her system, is devastated and baffled by a drug driving "legal loophole" in state legislation.

item.title: More than 50 couples marry in mass Gaza wedding after two years of Israeli attacks
item.description: Thousands of Palestinians turn out in Gaza's Khan Younis to celebrate the wedding of 54 couples who had been unable to tie the knot during Israel's bombardment of the strip.

item.title: Keysborough Secondary College staff member charged over stabbing of principal
item.description: A 37-year-old man will face court today over the stabbing of a school principal at Keysborough, in Melbourne's south-east. The man is a staff member at the school.

item.title: NSW Police Minister Yasmin Catley's driver charged with high-range drink-driving near Bega
item.description: The NSW government employee was seen allegedly driving dangerously in the Bemboka area.

item.title: Family unable to move from government housing next to drug den
item.description: A single mother-of-two no longer feels safe in her government-provided housing after her child found a used needle in their backyard.

item.title: Car crashes onto train tracks, sparking travel delays in the Blue Mountains
item.description: A complex operation is under way to remove a car that crashed onto train tracks in the Blue Mountains.

item.title: Live: Bruce Lehrmann loses appeal against failed defamation case ruling
item.description: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he had raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in 2019.

item.title: Hegseth says he 'didn't stick around' for second strike on boat
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Independent Bec Thomas says she has secured a 'cost cap' for the Hobart stadium
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her music in ICE video
item.description: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in their "inhumane agenda".
